comments: On an n X (n - 1)(n - 2)/2 X n(n - 1)/2 cuboid with n >= 5, the two points at greatest surface distance from a corner are the opposite corner and the point 1 in from each of the two edges on a smallest face which meet at the opposite corner; this greatest surface distance is sqrt(a(n)).
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
mathematica: Table[n^4/2 - n^3 + 3 n^2/2 - n + 1, {n, 0, 30}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 10 2014 *)
crossrefs: For n >= 4 the sequence is a subsequence of A007692.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jan 11 2001
